description:
Grafana is an open-source solution for querying, visualizing, alerting, and exploring metrics, logs, and traces, regardless of where they are stored. Grafana provides tools to transform your time-series database (TSDB) data into meaningful graphs and visualizations. Additionally, its plugin framework lets you integrate various data sources, including NoSQL/SQL databases, ticketing tools such as Jira or […]

The post Grafana: Open-Source Data Visualization Platform appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Grafana: Open-Source Data Visualization Platform

description:
AppImages are a popular way to distribute software on Linux systems. They are self-contained executable files that can run on most Linux distributions without installation. In this guide, we will use FreeTube as an example to demonstrate how to create a desktop shortcut for an AppImage and add it to the panel for quick access.

The post How to Create AppImage Shortcut in Ubuntu appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Create AppImage Shortcut in Ubuntu
